intro: Dombeya longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed dombeya, is a species of flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 3 meters, with lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stems. Dombeya longipes thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in moist, shaded forest environments. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in horticulture, though it is relatively rare in cultivation.
